explanation: The contract does not contain an explicit clause stating that the confidentiality obligations survive termination or expiration for a defined period of time. Section 4 merely says that any Confidential Information the Receiving Party is allowed to retain will remain subject to the Agreement "for so long as such material is retained," and Section 9 states only that termination does not relieve liability for prior breaches. Neither provision sets a specific survival period (e.g., five years) as required by the rule.
rule: State that confidentiality obligations survive termination or expiration of the NDA for the specified period.
exampleLanguage: The confidentiality obligations set forth in this Agreement shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement for a period of five (5) years.
